title: Ticket #7469: Ubuntu 16 package missing libglobus-gss-assist3 dependency
description:
When doing apt-get install htcondor on a fresh Ubuntu 16 system, it seems that some dependencies are missing, specifically libglobus-gss-assist3. Not having this dependency at install time also seems to cause other problems with setting up the initial htcondor config, even if the dependency is installed later, causing condor_master to, for example, complain about permissions to the $(LOG) directory.

It seems that the problem can be worked around by adding the dependency: apt-get install libglobus-gss-assist3 htcondor.

This problem is apparent, based on the output of apt list htcondor, in all versions of 8.9, and could also be present in previous/stable versions.
remarks:
2020-Apr-10 07:46:37 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080906 to v080907 using ticket-target-mover.

2020-Apr-11 09:29:59 by tim:
I am going to make this change in stable. I will add libglobus-gss-assist3 to the recommended packages. So, in the default case it will be installed. I'll have to investigate to see what the failures are when it is not present. I'll split that off into a derived ticket.

2020-Apr-13 09:24:14 by jpatton:
CODE REVIEW: LGTM. Seems like the lack of this package causes all sorts of havoc with the install script, so I could argue it's a depends not a recommends, but until we understand better why the install breaks, I'm fine with recommends.

2020-Apr-13 12:09:15 by tim:
I would argue that one should be able to run HTCondor without GSI. That is why I made the derived ticket.
